intro: Adesmia virens, commonly known as the greenleaf desmodium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces slender, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Adesmia virens is valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it useful in ecological restoration projects.
